page.title: 12PENTRE CONTROLLED SCHOOL
page.content: THIS IS A SMALL VILLAGE SCHOOL WITH ONLY 31 CHILDREN FROM 4 TO 11 YEARS. THE BUILDING IS ABOUT 150 YEARS OLD AND IN THE FIRST PLACE WAS A CHURCH. IT ISN'T A CHURCH ANY MORE, BUT THE SCHOOL STILL HAS CONNECTIONS WITH ST. MARY'S CHURCH IN CHIRK. THERE ARE ONLY TWO CHILDREN OF PRIMARY SCHOOL AGE IN THE VILLAGE, ALL THE OTHER CHILDREN COME TO SCHOOL IN CARS OR ON A BUS. IN THE PAST SOME CHILDREN HAD TO WALK 2 MILES TO SCHOOL THROUGH HALTON WOOD. IF THEY WERE LATE THEY WOULD SOMETIMES GET CANED.NO-ONE GETS CANED NOW, BUT SOMETIMES THE CHILDREN ARE STILL NAUGHTY. THE SCHOOL IS A HAPPY ONE.THERE ARE ONLY TWO TEACHERS.
